channel.title: Help, server wont run!
channel.description: I've portforwarded, set the IP, set no-ip, running DUC, running source, but i get "error connecting to server" Any suggestions?

item.title: Help, server wont run!
item.dc:creator: @clongitee clongitee
item.description:
@clongitee wrote:

[quote=“xneonx, post:8, topic:366058”][quote author=clongitee link=topic=462251.msg3381530#msg3381530 date=1288061607]
What do i search in client.java? i tried serverip, no-ip, .biz, .org, ip, etc.
[/quote] Try searching for 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0[/quote]

Nope…nothing came up.

Read full topic

item.title: Help, server wont run!
item.dc:creator: @xneonx xneonx
item.description:
@xneonx wrote:

[quote=“clongitee, post:5, topic:366058”]What do i search in client.java? i tried serverip, no-ip, .biz, .org, ip, etc.[/quote] Try searching for 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0

Read full topic

item.title: Help, server wont run!
item.dc:creator: @Sanskrit Sanskrit
item.description:
@Sanskrit wrote:

the ratio of {'s to }'s within your code should be 1 to 1. also make sure all statements end with a semicolon. In Javascript, semicolons ending statements are like periods ending sentences.

Read full topic

item.title: Help, server wont run!
item.dc:creator: @clongitee clongitee
item.description:
@clongitee wrote:

What do i search in client.java? i tried serverip, no-ip, .biz, .org, ip, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Help, server wont run!
item.dc:creator: @xneonx xneonx
item.description:
@xneonx wrote:

Yes you are supposed to put your no-ip in the source. Go into the client.java and the server.java. You can change there. In your 100 errors, you need to either add ; { } somewhere.

Read full topic

item.title: Help, server wont run!
item.dc:creator: @xneonx xneonx
item.description:
@xneonx wrote:

Did you set the ip to both the server and client and compile? If you did then check your ports inside of the client and server and what port you used on your portforwarding.

Read full topic
